reviews.sentence: False advertising. Reception looked okthe family room was nothing like the rooms on the site. We expected a big bathroom with a bath. The one in our room was about 2 meters. You could not sit in the toilet and close the door. No bath. Room wall dirty. We left immediately.

Okay. Staff is friendly and location is nearby the metro stop. The shower in the room is too small. The walls are very thin I could hear people talking and yelling in the halls. The breakfast is disappointing for the price and the gym is lacking everything.

Comfortable and convenient. We have stayed at this hotel a few times over the past 3 years as my daughter was studying at Erasmus university. As always the staff are very friendly and efficient. The hotel itself is reasonable modern. This time I requested a room for 3 people myself and my 2 daughters and accordingly paid a higher price. This unfortunately meant they put an extra bed in a room that already has a double bed and no space for a 3rd so it was very tight. Not ideal i would have preferred if they had told me that they do not cater fr 3 people in a room. None the less everything else was great and I would stay there again.

Lovely hotel in a good location. We wanted to change rooms away from the elevator suggested by Tripadvisor tips but were told that we had booked the basic room so it was not possible. It was a bit noisy but not really that bad. The bathroom is really small but luckily I am only 5 ft tall and slimThe service was good and the place was clean. Good price for a room can not complain. Great free wifiand air con and British TV channels.

Underwhelming four star deserves a rant. The Hampshire Savoy in Rotterdam is rated as a four star hotel. One of the reasons I booked a hotel at the Hampshire was the location but also as we were staying at least three days over the new years weekend I thought we had go for something pretty clean and comfortable that I thought I might be familiar with. Having been in a Hampshire hotel in Groningen I was ultimately disappointed by the one in Rotterdam. At the same price the contrast was glaring. The hotel in Groningen although not centrally located was modern sleek clean and bright everything the Savoy in Rotterdam was not. The positive Like I have read from many reviews the staff at the reception are incredibly friendly and are doing a wonderful job. The location of the hotel is very good for a weekend visit very close walk to the city center and the wonderful Markthal which honestly might be the best thing Rotterdam has going for it. The negative. Brace yourselves. the place needs and update in info and style. The confusing WiFi information. I am not sure but I think Hampshire no longer has the paying WiFi in the room despite the dated information in the little hotel book thingy. If it is free the book needs an update. If one still has to pay for WiFi which I think and hope we did not do. well that is in itself out dated. In terms of style the whole hotel could use major overhauling or a reduction in its star rating. It is to be crude an ugly hotel. I read reviews dating back from 2013 where the response by a hotel representative to a commentator pointing out the dreariness of the place was that an overhaul was going to happen. Well three four years later and I suspect nothing has happened. The room itself looked like the rest of the place. The colors of the room were dark and gloomy. The lamps did not brighten up anything. We were in room 102 a corner room next to the elevator facing a grey building and a small ugly street. I know there is always an option to upgrade and pay for superior rooms which are the same rooms I suspect the Hampshire likes to use to promote itself on their website. but at some point one has to wonder if the cheapest and smallest room at a hotel should not account for the general standard of the place. The room had no minibar we chilled our cheap bottle of new years Proseco near the window a sad experience indeed the tv was not plugged in and I do not mean the electricity plug I mean the thing that plugs the tv to the box so we can get channels surely an odd thing to be unplugged. We also got the fake double bed thing where you can fall in the gap in the middle when the beds drift apart at night those things should be banned. The room was dirty. The table under the TV had white dried out crusty bits on it. There were cups and a boiler but the inside of the boiler was filthy. So much so that we did not even have the courage to ask for it to be cleaned because frankly we just did not want to use it anymorelet us just generally say that it is not a room one wanted to inspect too closely for dirt and stains. The bathroom could have used a round of thorough cleaning and was very small. Lack of Isolation and heat We heard everything through the doors and the walls it is not very isolated and you can hear everything that is going on in the hall way. Although the aircon heater thing seemed to be turned on it did not feel like 25 degrees celsius. We might have been confused to how the thing worked but by default the room was cold when we got there and stayed cold until we leftThe price I did not look too closely at the hotel room price it was expensive for what we got. What felt like a rip off was the price of breakfast. I decided to include breakfast online the day before. I got the bokingcom ap so I got a message saying that the total price of the room was updated to include breakfast. When we got to the hotel the receptionist said the room was paid for so I assumed that included the latest modification concerning breakfast. However it did not and I had to pay a city tax still do not know what that was for and breakfast for the full three days at the end of our stay. They registered that we only had breakfast once despite ordering it for the full trip and as a goodwill I do not know why we could not have just paid for that one morning. We do admit responsibility for booking breakfast in advance for the three days but there was to my knowledge not an option to just book it for one day but they were aware we only consumed it once they even said so at the reception. The breakfast is 17 euros by head by day. so yeah an expensive affair indeed. All in all what is frustrating and somewhat anger inducing is the misleading star rating. It is majorly inflated for this hotel and if it is based on the quality of the superior rooms I can only conclude that no faith can be given in these ratings. I also think that rather than concentrating the efforts in overhauling the superior rooms I can only assume they are in better state I might be wrong. a hotel can prove its worth by making even the cheaper rooms clean hygienic pleasant and somewhat comfortable to stay in. Until then I can not recommend this hotel and I will probably not return there myself Kudos to the reception staff though.

Conveniently located hotel in Rotterdam. Accommodating staff location is great bedroom is great. Only criticism is the bathrooms but price is great so can not complain too much. Location bedrooms Close to shopping dining areas port. Bathroom.

Nice location but the standard rooms are too small and noisy. Location is perfect. Breakfast is good and the staff are very friendly. The room was next to the elevator and very noisy. When I made a comment to the reception they said this a a standard room so I should have taken an upgrade. The rooms are smal and the bathroom is not a bathroom. TOO small. Toilet is almost in the shower and the shower you can not move around. You get in and out in the same position.
Pleasant. I could not use the washbasin it was so small and impractical. Bathroom in general the tiniest I have ever experienced. No soap or conditioner in rooms. 4 star. I do not think so.

Football pay TV in lobby barvery friendly stafloud door clapping on floors late nighthair on bathroom floor at arivaladvance payment at arivalno advance checkout at the eve of departure bill can only be printed on last day.
Property is ok but room was not in full working order even after I let front desk know about issues. Issues were minor but significant. No soap and broken tv.

All Pretty Good. Stayed for just one night the other week. Nice efficient check in with very professional and friendly receptionist. Yes they are just finishing renovation refurb but it really did not effect us. We had a new room rooms are very comfortable and all you could want. Although probably trying to put too much in a limited space ie I crashed into a low level nest of tables next to the bed which there really was no room for. The bathroom is very well appointed but not built for any one us who is not as thin as an athlete let us say. Bar is really nice good selection of spirits and usual beers all served by a really friendly and helpful young man. Breakfast is standard selection for breakfast in Rotterdam and all very nice. For the price this is an extremely nice place to say for a few nights.
Great location very nice and comfy rooms. The room has been just refurbished Cleanliness in generalLocation. Breakfast was not the best.

Perfect friendly and profesional. I found the staff to absolutely amazing the gentlemen that was working the night of our arrival was exceedingly friendly and professional. Housekeeping was friendly and would not let a single guest pass without at least a smile if not saying good morning. I was worried prior to arrival as this was the first trip with my partner and wanted it to be perfect. The hotel exceeded my expectations and was in all meaning of the word perfect will visit againEverything was brilliant If I was to add anything at all I would of liked more vinyls for the record player in the room. However that is me being very picky.
Was disappointed with size of room. Location excellent bed good bathroom good. Limited breakfast some of it ok was better last time 5 years ago.
Exceptional. Very nice and cosy room. Nothing in particular.
Great hotel Coffee and tea making facilities nice unique touches in room. Fantastic location and parking reasonable and over the road.
I liked the decoration of the room but they did n’t have a room service. Also the housekeeping was not so good the cleaning of the rooms needs supervision.

Good. Vinyl in the room was a great touch. Shower was big. Loved the Nespreso machine. Good air con if needed. Can’t say a bad word really. Great location lovely room and staff where very very nice helpful.

Brilliant. Enjoyed everything about this hotel. Clean and spacious room. Parking nearby at 17euros a day. Staff friendly and helpful. English speaking. Many places to eat nearby and near tram and metro too. Would stay again.

Lovely hotel and great value for money. Booked this hotel very last minute due to a mix up with other accommodation. Staff were friendly and helpful upon arrival room was clean the bed was very comfortable and the shower was great. The room was also thoroughly cleaned each day. Staff gladly called taxis as and when needed the drivers turned up in brand new Mercedes wearing suits and ties nice touch. Bar was well stocked and carried cheaper prices than I ’d experienced out in the city. All round flawless experience and would certainly stay again.
